These data are from the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES) and list the contracting parties to the convention [http://www.cites.org/eng/ disc/parties/alphabet.php](http://www.cites.org/eng/ disc/parties/alphabet.php). The Convention is an international agreement between governments that aims at ensuring that any international trade in plants and animals “does not threaten their survival.” All countries party to the Convention are given full credit for membership; those countries that are not contracting parties are given no credit (score = 0).
